programme.title: SportsCenter with Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: Host Scott Van Pelt covers all of the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: TGL Golf
programme.desc: The Bay Golf Club (3-0-0) sits atop the standings with six points and remains the only team without a loss after defeating Boston Common Golf, 5-4, on Feb. 17; Jupiter Links GC (1-2-0) suffered a 10-3 setback to New York Golf Club on Feb. 18.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 2 Duke (24-3, 15-1) won four straight behind Cooper Flagg, who is second in the ACC with 19.5 ppg, and beat the Hurricanes, 89-54, on Jan. 14 behind 25 points from Kon Knueppel; Miami (6-21, 2-14) has all six wins at home, going 6-9.

programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: Players get prepared for the upcoming game through their warm-up routines, as cameras go around the arena to see the fans get excited with tipoff nearing and capture the pregame energy before the starting five lineups are announced.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Houston claimed victories over San Antonio in two of their first three meetings of the season, winning the most recent matchup on Nov. 6 with a 127-100 scoreline; Fred VanVleet and Jalen Green both had 21 points for the Rockets in the win.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: South Carolina claimed an 85-56 victory over Ole Miss in their lone meeting from the 2023-24 season on Feb. 4, 2024, behind 17 points and 4 blocks from Kamilla Cardoso; Madison Scott posted 17 points and 8 rebounds for the Rebels in the loss.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: North Carolina claimed a 53-46 overtime win over Duke in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 9, led by Alyssa Ustby's 10 points and 12 rebounds; Ashlon Jackson posted 10 points for the Blue Devils' loss while Jadyn Donovan added 11 rebounds.

programme.title: UFC Main Event
programme.desc: Jorge Masvidal (34-13), who is coming off the fastest knockout victory in UFC history after defeating Ben Askrem on July 6 in five seconds, takes on The Ultimate Fighter 5 lightweight winner Nate Diaz (20-11) for the "BMF" title in the main event.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: Good Guy/Bad Guy
programme.desc: UFC heavyweight and light heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier and UFC Hall of Fame member Chael Sonnen break down the latest from around the MMA world, recapping recent marquee events, the latest injury updates and guest interviews.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Baylor (16-11, 8-8) dropped five of its last eight, but is 3-0 against the Bearcats after a 68-48 win on Jan. 7 behind 18 points from both Norchad Omier and VJ Edgecombe; Cincinnati (16-11, 6-10) won four of its last six, and is 11-4 at home.

programme.title: College Basketball Live
programme.desc: Game commentators provide a detailed look at all things pertaining to college basketball, including previews of upcoming games, analysis of game-changing moments, discussions on breaking news, highlights of top players and more.

programme.title: UFC Main Event
programme.desc: Zhang Weili (20-1) defended her UFC Women's Strawweight Championship for the first time since beating Jessica Andrade for it at Fight Night 157 as she went up against Joanna Jedrzejczyk (16-3) in the main event of UFC 248 in a memorable bout.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 24 Mississippi State (19-8, 7-7) won two of its last three games, both coming against ranked opponents; No. 6 Alabama (22-5, 11-3) leads the country in scoring at 90.8 ppg behind Mark Sears, and won its last seven meetings with the Bulldogs.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: The Hoop Collective
programme.desc: Brian Windhorst and a group of ESPN insiders cover anything and everything from around the NBA, breaking down the latest stories making headlines, recapping and previewing marquee matchups, and interviewing guests to gather their thoughts.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: Through the use of archived footage, big fights from previous UFC cards are featured to show some of the top matches that have occurred over the years, as belts are put on the line, reputations are challenged and rivals battle for victory.

programme.desc: Mina Kimes brings her vast NFL knowledge and unique insight to the top stories making headlines across the league, breaking down the impact of the news, and is joined by guests to gather a different perspective on all things football.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Ole Miss (19-8, 8-6) lost its last two games; No. 1 Auburn (25-2, 13-1) is 12-1 at home behind a top-10 scoring offense, and won its last seven meetings with the Rebels after a 92-82 win on Feb. 1 behind 20 points and 12 rebounds from Johni Broome.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: Analysts cover the latest around the world of the NHL, featuring highlights from recent games, previews of upcoming marquee matchups, the newest stories making headlines and all-access footage to give viewers a unique look at their favorite players.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Texas (16-11, 5-9) dropped four of its last five games despite Tre Johnson, who leads the SEC in scoring with 20.2 ppg; Arkansas (16-11, 5-9) defeated the Longhorns, 78-70, on Feb. 5 behind 24 points from Johnell Davis and 14 from Adou Thiero.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Coverage of college basketball games.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Lakers beat Philadelphia in the NBA Finals in 1980, 1982 and 1983, while Boston won the crown by beating Houston in 1981; Los Angeles and Boston staged the first of three epic battles in 1984, and the rivalry transformed fans' view of the game.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: The latest news and updates surrounding the fighters competing in the upcoming UFC event are featured, breaking down the fight card with in-depth analysis of the premier matches highlighting the event, along with profiles of the combatants.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In 1978, the Celtics drafted Larry Bird, but he played his final year at Indiana State before signing; Los Angeles selected Magic Johnson No. 1 in 1979 after he led Michigan State to a victory over Bird and the Sycamores in the NCAA title game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: New Mexico (22-5, 14-2) had its eight-game win streak snapped by Boise State, 86-78, but beat the Aztecs, 62-48, on Jan. 11 behind 16 points from Donovan Dent, who leads Mountain West scoring; San Diego State (18-7, 11-5) is 10-3 at home this season.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Coverage of college basketball games.

programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: IndyCar Practice
programme.desc: IndyCar drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the upcoming race; crews work to set up the car.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Vegas claimed a 3-2 victory over Indy in their first meeting of the 2025 season on Jan. 31 behind 15 kills and a pair of blocks from Hannah Maddux; Nina Cajic posted 14 kills and 9 digs for the Ignite in the defeat away from home.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Three-time winner of the tournament Deportivo Saprissa secured a 2-1 victory over Vancouver Whitecaps FC in the first leg matchup at Estadio Ricardo Saprissa Aymá on Feb. 20, as Ariel Rodríguez scored the match-winner in second-half stoppage time.

programme.title: NRL Hits Vegas
programme.desc: The NRL stepped outside of Australia to open its 2024 season under the bright, neon lights of Las Vegas, as the documentary shows all-access footage and interviews with the people that made it happen and the players who got a unique experience.

programme.title: Copa America 2024: Argentina's Road to Glory

programme.title: Coupe de France
programme.desc: Dunkerque advanced past Lille in the Round of 16 in a shootout, 5-4, after Kay Tejan scored the equalizer in second-half stoppage time; Abdallah Sima notched the match-winner in second-half stoppage time, as Brestois defeated Troyes, 2-1, on Feb. 4.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Corey Heim opened the 2025 season with a victory at Daytona to gain an early three-point lead over defending champion Ty Majeski; Kyle Busch averaged 111.425 mph en route to his win at Atlanta last year, beating Majeski by 0.187 seconds.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Corey Heim opened the 2025 season with a victory at Daytona to gain an early three-point lead over defending champion Ty Majeski; Kyle Busch averaged 111.425 mph en route to his win at Atlanta last year, beating Majeski by 0.187 seconds.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Colorado Rapids won the first leg matchup vs. Los Angeles FC with a 2-1 victory at Dick's Sporting Goods Park on Feb. 18, as Djordje Mihailović notched a brace in the second half; Los Angeles FC was the runner-up in the 2020 and 2023 edition.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: FC Cincinnati looks to advance to the Round of 16 after cruising to a 4-1 victory over Honduran side Motagua at Estadio José de la Paz Herrera Uclés in the first leg matchup on Feb. 19, as Pavel Bucha notched a brace with a goal in each half.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Inter Miami CF secured a 1-0 triumph over Sporting Kansas City in the first leg matchup at Children's Mercy Park on Feb. 19, as Lionel Messi found the back of the net off an assist from Sergio Busquets in the 56th minute.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: William Byron became only the fourth driver to win back-to-back Daytona 500 races after taking the opener over Tyler Reddick; Daniel Suarez averaged 115.398 mph en route to his win last year, defeating Ryan Blaney by 0.003 seconds.

programme.title: So Damn Close
programme.desc: The 2024 Ambetter Health 400 made sure the follow-up to the opening Daytona 500 would be a memorable one, as Daniel Suarez, Ryan Blaney and Kyle Busch would put together the closest three-wide photo finish in NASCAR Cup Series history.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Costa Rican side Herediano and MLS club Real Salt Lake played to a scoreless draw at Estadio Nacional de Costa Rica in the first leg matchup on Feb. 19; Real Salt Lake was the runner-up to Monterrey in the 2010-11 edition of the tournament.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Seattle Sounders FC broke a 1-1 tie with two unanswered goals in the second half to beat Guatemalan club Antigua GFC at Estadio Pensativo in the first leg matchup, 3-1, on Feb. 19, as Pedro de la Vega scored the game-winner in the 61st minute.
